subject: Nutrition
title: Correlation vs Causation in Nutrition
description: Learn Correlation vs Causation in Nutrition in one minute.

hook.text: People who eat organic food have lower cancer rates. That doesn't mean organic food prevents cancer.

buildup.text: Observational studies track what people eat and what happensâ€”but they can't prove what caused what.

discovery.text: Organic shoppers also exercise more, smoke less, and earn higher incomesâ€”all of which reduce cancer risk.

twist.text: Nicolas Cage films correlate with pool drownings. Correlation is easy to find and hard to interpret.

climax.text: Only randomized controlled trials can establish cause and effect. Most nutrition studies aren't that.

punchline.text: Linked doesn't mean caused. Always ask how.
